metadata.title: CVE-2023-52583 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - negligible
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: ceph:fix deadlock or deadcode of misusing dget() The lock order is incorrectbetween denty and its parent, we should always make sure that the parentget the lock first. But since this deadcode is never used and the parentdir will always be set from the callers, let's just remove it.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-52583` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-2.16
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-225-generic - 4.15.0-225.237~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-225-generic - 4.15.0-225.237~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-225-lowlatency - 4.15.0-225.237~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1094-kvm - 4.4.0-1004.9
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1129-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1168-aws - 4.15.0-1168.181~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1177-azure - 4.15.0-1177.192~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1162-gcp - 4.15.0-1162.179~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1131-oracle - 4.15.0-1131.142~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-2.16').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-225.237~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1004.9').
linux-aws package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1001.10').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1168.181~16.04.1').
